reviews.title: Soul-less and out-of-the-way
reviews.text: The Occidental is a large, impersonal hotel located across from the train station. You either need to take a taxi (more about that later) or a 30 minute walk through a dirty, iffy neighborhood to get to the tourist attractions. They seem to get a lot of tour buses and conventions at this hotel. Unlike most other hotels we stayed in Spain, the rooms are carpeted. The rooms were of an adequate size but the AC was not great. There is a pool and an antiquated gym. We did not eat at the Occidental so cannot comment on food except that they did bring up a complimentary little snack of sherry and cold salmon which was quite good.

We had a very unpleasant incident with a cab driver who physically assaulted a member of our party by pushing him when we complained that he drove us all over the city to jack up the fare. Even though we paid the driver, he screamed and cursed at us and followed us into the hotel. The desk people tried unsuccessfully to find security help and said that they would report the cab driver. They were apologetic for the city.
reviews.title: Grumpy staff, poor service.
Occidental Seville - Magnificent!
reviews.text: We only booked this hotel because it was across from the train station. The location for the regular tourist is bad.

reviews.text: For the price, the accommodation is good. Hotel security personnel would look at you AND the children as if you were a suspect not a guest.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.disliked: — Person at the reception area by the name of Mabel who was rude, obnoxious and racist

reviews.text: The Occidental Hotel's main attraction is its close proximity to the Santa Justa train station. We stayed there for 1 night while in transit, returning by train from Granada at night time, and then flying out of the Sevilla airport the next morning.
reviews.title: Convenient to the Santa Justa train station

reviews.text: The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The style was a bit on the conservative side, and the hotel definitely didn't have a strong personality. The marble bathroom was large and easy to use.
reviews.title: Fine hotel but not central

reviews.text: We decided to visit Sevilla's historic district for tapas one more time before departing, and easily caught a taxi at about 10pm. Unfortunately, we struggled to find a taxi on the way back at 12:30am, and the hotel was too far to consider walking.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The hotel's service bears a special mention. They were willing to hold our luggage overnight while we visited Granada as a side trip. Considering the large size of our 2 suitcases, this was a very nice gesture made by the hotel.

If you are a tourist looking for a hotel that is convenient to Sevilla's main attractions, I wouldn't suggest staying here as it's too far away. However, if you're looking for a nice hotel near the station, this is a good bet.
reviews.title: Good base fro exploring Seville
